title: 79/295. Cooperation between the United Nations and the Gulf Cooperation Council

paragraphs.1: Welcomes the enhanced partnership between the United Nations and the Gulf Cooperation Council in the areas of conflict prevention and resolution and mediation;
paragraphs.2: Emphasizes the importance of high-level consultations between the Secretary-General of the United Nations and the Secretary-General of the Gulf Cooperation Council, and encourages the continuation of annual strategic dialogue meetings;
paragraphs.3: Requests the United Nations Secretariat, within existing resources and, where appropriate, through voluntary contributions: (a) To support capacity-building initiatives within the conflict prevention and resolution mechanisms of the Gulf Cooperation Council; (b) To provide technical assistance in developing early warning systems and preventive diplomacy capabilities; (c) To share best practices and expertise in preventive diplomacy, mediation and dialogue facilitation;
paragraphs.4: Encourages the establishment of a joint working group, within existing resources and, where appropriate, through voluntary contributions, on regional peace and security: (a) To develop coordinated approaches to addressing regional emerging threats and challenges; (b) To enhance information-sharing and analysis of regional developments; (c) To strengthen cooperation in preventive diplomacy and mediation efforts as well as post-conflict peacebuilding and reconciliation;
paragraphs.5: Calls for the organization of regular expert-level meetings between the United Nations and the Gulf Cooperation Council, within existing resources and, where appropriate, through voluntary contributions: (a) To exchange views on regional security developments; (b) To coordinate responses to regional common challenges; (c) To develop joint initiatives for conflict prevention and resolution;
paragraphs.6: Requests relevant specialized United Nations agencies, programmes and institutions, within existing resources and, where appropriate, through voluntary contributions, in accordance with their mandates: (a) To strengthen their engagement with the Gulf Cooperation Council secretariat; (b) To provide technical support for capacity-building in conflict prevention and resolution; (c) To assist in developing regional mechanisms for crisis management;
paragraphs.7: Encourages, within existing resources and, where appropriate, through voluntary contributions, the development of joint training programmes and workshops to enhance the institutional capacity of the Gulf Cooperation Council in: (a) Conflict analysis and early warning; (b) Preventive diplomacy and mediation; (c) Post-conflict peacebuilding and reconciliation;
paragraphs.8: Requests the Secretary-General of the United Nations to submit to the General Assembly, at its eightieth session, a report on the implementation of the present resolution, within existing resources and, where appropriate, through voluntary contributions;
paragraphs.9: Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its eightieth session, under the item entitled “Cooperation between the United Nations and regional and other organizations”, a sub-item entitled “Cooperation between the United Nations and the Gulf Cooperation Council” and to consider the sub-item again at its eighty-first session and thereafter on a biennial basis.
